description:
Catenuloplanes niger is a species of bacterium that belongs to the phylum Actinobacteria. It is a Gram-positive, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacterium. The cells of Catenuloplanes niger are typically rod-shaped and can form long chains or catenae, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Catenuloplanes.

The colonies of Catenuloplanes niger are typically black or dark-colored, which is the origin of the species name "niger" meaning "black" in Latin. The bacterium is known to produce a melanin-like pigment, which contributes to its distinctive coloration.

Catenuloplanes niger is typically found in soil and other terrestrial environments. It is believed to play a role in the decomposition of organic matter and the cycling of nutrients in the environment. The specific ecological functions and metabolic capabilities of this bacterium are still under investigation by researchers.
